metadata.title: {{TITLE}}
learning_objectives: Understand the key variables in this system
Identify the causal relationships between variables
Recognize whether loops are reinforcing or balancing
Predict system behavior based on loop structure
metadata.author: {{AUTHOR}}

edges.description: More of variable 1 leads to more of variable 2
More of variable 2 leads to more of variable 3
More of variable 3 leads to more of variable 4
More of variable 4 leads to more of variable 1

loops.label: Main Feedback Loop
loops.description: This reinforcing loop shows how all four variables amplify each other

discussion_questions: What happens to the system if variable 1 increases?
How would a decrease in variable 3 affect the other variables?
Where might you intervene to change system behavior?
What real-world systems exhibit similar dynamics?
key_insights: All variables in a reinforcing loop move in the same direction over time
Small changes can amplify through the feedback loop
The loop structure determines system behavior patterns

common_misconceptions.correction: Positive polarity means same direction - increase leads to increase, decrease leads to decrease

extension_activities: Identify a real-world example of this system pattern
Add a balancing loop to counteract the reinforcing dynamics
Research historical examples of this type of feedback
